title: How to Make Pumpkin Mac and Cheese

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
steps.description: This dish will take you approximately 25 minutes and 25 minutes to bake. It will serve six people.

steps.headline: Cook and drain the macaroni noodles.
steps.description: Place a pot of water over medium-high heat. When the water reaches a rolling boil, pour the package of noodles into it. Cook the noodles as instructed on the package, using the minimum cook time suggested.

steps.headline: Melt the butter in a two-quart saucepan.
steps.description: Measure out ¼ cup of butter and melt it over low heat in the saucepan. Measure out ¼ cup all-purpose flour and add it to the melted butter in the saucepan. Use a whisk to stir the ingredients together. Stir constantly and cook for one minute.

steps.headline: Remove the saucepan from heat to add milk.
steps.description: Measure out two cups of milk and add them to the saucepan. Stir well with a whisk. Place the saucepan back over the heat and bring the mixture to a simmer. Stir constantly with the whisk. Simmer the mixture for one minute until it thickens.

steps.headline: Add spices and the canned pumpkin to the saucepan.
steps.description: Measure out the salt, pepper, nutmeg and mustard and add them to the mixture. Stir gently to combine the ingredients. Open the can of pumpkin and measure out one cup of it. Add it to the mixture. Continue to stir the ingredients.

steps.headline: Add the shredded cheddar cheese.
steps.description: Measure out 1 ¾ cup of shredded cheddar to the saucepan. Stir occasionally. Cook over low heat until the cheese melts.

steps.headline: Add the cooked macaroni noodles to the saucepan.
steps.description: Once the cheese has completely melted, add the cooked noodles to the cheese sauce mixture. Stir well. Keep stirring until the macaroni noodles are completely coated with the sauce.

steps.headline: Pour it into a casserole dish and bake for 20 to 25 minutes.
steps.description: Transfer the mac and cheese into a three-quart ungreased casserole dish. Sprinkle the remaining ¼ cup of cheddar on top. Place it in the oven and bake it, uncovered, until the top looks golden brown. If you like a very crispy top, set your oven to broil for the last one to two minutes of baking. Take the dish out once the top is brown and bubbling. Carefully remove the dish from the oven and serve immediately.

methods.name: Making Vegan Pumpkin Macaroni and Cheese

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
steps.description: While the oven is preheating, prepare a 9x13-inch pan by greasing it with a light coat of coconut oil or olive oil cooking spray.

steps.headline: Cook and drain the pasta.
steps.description: Put a pot of water on to boil. When the water reaches a rolling boil, pour the shells or penne noodles into it. Cook the noodles as instructed on the package, using the minimum cook time suggested. Once the pasta is al dente, drain it and rinse the noodles with cool water. Feel free to use the more traditional elbow macaroni for this. You can use whole wheat or gluten-free pasta, as well.

steps.headline: Add pumpkin, garlic, thyme, salt and coconut milk to a saucepan.
steps.description: Measure out these ingredients. Add them to a large saucepan. Cook the ingredients, uncovered, over medium heat. Stir the mixture regularly. Make sure the pumpkin stays submerged in the liquid ingredients. You can use organic canned pumpkin, if you prefer. Use about one and a half 15 ounce cans.

steps.headline: Simmer the mixture for 30 minutes.
steps.description: Keep the saucepan over medium heat, uncovered. Stir occasionally. After about 30 minutes, the pumpkin should be fork-tender. Remove the thyme sprigs.

steps.headline: Puree the pumpkin-coconut milk mixture.
steps.description: Once cooked, carefully transfer the mixture from the saucepan to your blender. Puree the mixture until it looks very smooth. It should have an almost velvety consistency.

steps.headline: Put the cooked pasta and puree into the greased pan.
steps.description: Spread the cooked noodles out evenly in the 9x13-inch pan. Pour the pumpkin-coconut milk puree over the top of the pasta. Fold the nutritional yeast gently into the noodles. Stir the mixture well until all of the noodles are coated with the puree and yeast.

steps.headline: Bake it for 30 minutes.
steps.description: Use aluminum foil to cover the pan. Place the pan in the preheated oven. After approximately 30 minutes, it should be bubbly and cooked through completely. Remove the pan from the oven and remove the foil from the top.

steps.headline: Combine the ingredients for the herbed bread crumb topping.
steps.description: While the mac and cheese bakes, make the topping. Mix ½ cup of bread crumbs with the granulated garlic powder, sea salt and chopped kale leaves. Stir gently until well mixed.

steps.headline: Add the topping and broil the dish.
steps.description: Sprinkle the bread crumb topping and remaining two tablespoons of nutritional yeast on top of the mac and cheese. Set your oven to broil. Place the pan, uncovered, back into the oven for two to three minutes. Remove the dish once the top looks browned and bubbly. Serve it immediately.

text: Making Pumpkin Macaroni and Cheese Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). This dish will take you approximately 25 minutes and 25 minutes to bake. It will serve six people. Cook and drain the macaroni noodles. Place a pot of water over medium-high heat. When the water reaches a rolling boil, pour the package of noodles into it. Cook the noodles as instructed on the package, using the minimum cook time suggested. Melt the butter in a two-quart saucepan. Measure out ¼ cup of butter and melt it over low heat in the saucepan. Measure out ¼ cup all-purpose flour and add it to the melted butter in the saucepan. Use a whisk to stir the ingredients together. Stir constantly and cook for one minute. Remove the saucepan from heat to add milk. Measure out two cups of milk and add them to the saucepan. Stir well with a whisk. Place the saucepan back over the heat and bring the mixture to a simmer. Stir constantly with the whisk. Simmer the mixture for one minute until it thickens. Add spices and the canned pumpkin to the saucepan. Measure out the salt, pepper, nutmeg and mustard and add them to the mixture. Stir gently to combine the ingredients. Open the can of pumpkin and measure out one cup of it. Add it to the mixture. Continue to stir the ingredients. Add the shredded cheddar cheese. Measure out 1 ¾ cup of shredded cheddar to the saucepan. Stir occasionally. Cook over low heat until the cheese melts. Add the cooked macaroni noodles to the saucepan. Once the cheese has completely melted, add the cooked noodles to the cheese sauce mixture. Stir well. Keep stirring until the macaroni noodles are completely coated with the sauce. Pour it into a casserole dish and bake for 20 to 25 minutes. Transfer the mac and cheese into a three-quart ungreased casserole dish. Sprinkle the remaining ¼ cup of cheddar on top. Place it in the oven and bake it, uncovered, until the top looks golden brown. If you like a very crispy top, set your oven to broil for the last one to two minutes of baking. Take the dish out once the top is brown and bubbling. Carefully remove the dish from the oven and serve immediately. Making Vegan Pumpkin Macaroni and Cheese Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). While the oven is preheating, prepare a 9x13-inch pan by greasing it with a light coat of coconut oil or olive oil cooking spray. Cook and drain the pasta. Put a pot of water on to boil. When the water reaches a rolling boil, pour the shells or penne noodles into it. Cook the noodles as instructed on the package, using the minimum cook time suggested. Once the pasta is al dente, drain it and rinse the noodles with cool water. Feel free to use the more traditional elbow macaroni for this. You can use whole wheat or gluten-free pasta, as well. Add pumpkin, garlic, thyme, salt and coconut milk to a saucepan. Measure out these ingredients. Add them to a large saucepan. Cook the ingredients, uncovered, over medium heat. Stir the mixture regularly. Make sure the pumpkin stays submerged in the liquid ingredients. You can use organic canned pumpkin, if you prefer. Use about one and a half 15 ounce cans. Simmer the mixture for 30 minutes. Keep the saucepan over medium heat, uncovered. Stir occasionally. After about 30 minutes, the pumpkin should be fork-tender. Remove the thyme sprigs. Puree the pumpkin-coconut milk mixture. Once cooked, carefully transfer the mixture from the saucepan to your blender. Puree the mixture until it looks very smooth. It should have an almost velvety consistency. Put the cooked pasta and puree into the greased pan. Spread the cooked noodles out evenly in the 9x13-inch pan. Pour the pumpkin-coconut milk puree over the top of the pasta. Fold the nutritional yeast gently into the noodles. Stir the mixture well until all of the noodles are coated with the puree and yeast. Bake it for 30 minutes. Use aluminum foil to cover the pan. Place the pan in the preheated oven. After approximately 30 minutes, it should be bubbly and cooked through completely. Remove the pan from the oven and remove the foil from the top. Combine the ingredients for the herbed bread crumb topping. While the mac and cheese bakes, make the topping. Mix ½ cup of bread crumbs with the granulated garlic powder, sea salt and chopped kale leaves. Stir gently until well mixed. Add the topping and broil the dish. Sprinkle the bread crumb topping and remaining two tablespoons of nutritional yeast on top of the mac and cheese. Set your oven to broil. Place the pan, uncovered, back into the oven for two to three minutes. Remove the dish once the top looks browned and bubbly. Serve it immediately.
